author: Angus Gow
title: Insurance Claims Processing
description: Insurance fraud costs the UK around £1.3bn, applying dApps and tokenisation to the insurance process this could be greatly reduced.

assessments.note:
This is a duplicate proposal and should be withdrawn.
Original proposal - https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088
This idea is in twice. No detail on what is being developed and how honesty would be assessed.
Impossible to asses given the information in the proposal.

it is important that more details are described about the problem, because in order for us to measure the impact of a proposal it is necessary to understand the size of the problem. Why would blockchains help reduce insurance costs? What is the potential for cost savings? The plan is still a draft and has few details.

*The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.
Bringing insurance policies and automated claim processing would indeed drive adoption.
The aim of the proposal to reduce insurance fraud using blockchain is good however the solution offered is not clear or complete and the process to prevent the fraud has not been explained clearly.

In my opinion this proposal is a real implementation in insurance financial services that could improve the transactions volume on cardano blockchain, but It isn't clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem and for the stakeholders (in deep detail for users, insurers and so on.. ). However the objective of the proposal is very interesting. The prototype is nice and funny, but there isn't any screenshot or demo available. I think there is a value for the customers, in security and simplicity

First of all, the proposer has stated in the comments that this proposal is a duplication of his own first proposal. This means that this specific proposal is a copy of another one. I have checked and the original/first submission is at:

https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088

Hence, as this proposal is already a copy of an existing one - according to the proposer - a copy will not address the challenge effectively - and I am downvoting it as a copy. So that the original proposal (according to the proposer's own comment) can be assessed

(This is a duplicate of another proposal by the same team) The proposer claims to be wanting to build a dApp that tackles insurance fraud, but he offers no description of the actual dApp, why it would be necessary to be built on the Cardano ecosystem and how it would increase utility and adoption of it.
The proposed use case has validity, but the proposal lacks any data to support the legitimacy of the project.

This proposal can provide benefits to the insurance industry and some to participating users. However it is too expensive with the funds demanded. THe proposal is not detailed enough to determine the exact use it will provide.

This is a duplicate proposal and should be withdrawn.
Original proposal - https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088
Please provide a detailed plan with milestones. How will you asses honesty? Why is an honesty token worth more than the large payout for dishonesty under an insurance contract?
Very little information on the team behind this and what the actual task is.

The plan is still a draft. There are no details on how the proposal will prevent fraud. There is little information about the team, I recommend providing details about how many people will be part of the proposal and details about the experience and qualifications of each one, also indicating what will be their role in the proposal. It is important to detail the budget allocation better. If the budget is used in its entirety to pay developers, I recommend detailing the work to be performed by the devs and an estimate of hours for the work to be performed.

I also recommend that the team follow the Catalyst documentation as a reference to prepare a proposal.

*The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.

No plan for the implementation is presented. The somewhat relevant experience (the claim of operating a Cardano stakepool and having systems dev experience) is not presented in a verifiable manner. The budget of $150k has no breakdown.

The proposal required a strong team to secure regulator compliance, development, marketing, and adaptation by established users. The proposer has not brought out how he will develop this team and how they are going to be managed.

The proposal team seams  skilled and expertise, so in my opinion will able to make a good pilot. In relation to the possible success of the initiative, there are poor indications related to marketing and communication for the product launch, neither about the customers adoption. Further I think it's important to improve details about the process related to the issue related to the market or capital risk

The proposer explains in a comment that this proposal is a duplication of his own first proposal. The proposal that the proposer wants to be assessed is the first one that can be found below: 

https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088

However, in addition to that fact, I would point out that the plan and budget and timetable and experience are given in the most general of forms and it seems unlikely the proposal would be implemented successfully.

Not enough details for the proposer's experience, he provided a link to the phone app that he's working on, but even there I couldn't find anything regarding his prior experience. The proposal needs to be developed further, this is more of a draft. I understood from his comment that this is a duplicate of another identical proposal, but he should have withdrawn it when he noticed there's a second one.

The team has developed a (not yet live) insurance app and run a stake pool. No technical understanding of the blockchain implementation is expressed in the proposal.  There is no roadmap provided and the proposal lacks any detail. For this reason I do not believe the proposal will be successfully implemented.

This is a duplicate proposal and should be withdrawn.
Original proposal - https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088
More details on technical and economic  model. What is the sales channel to get the product accepted even if it is developed? Where is the budget justifying $150,000 funding request?

Extremely limited information in the proposal, especially given the very high fund request. Some information I'm missing: who are the team, what are the deliverables, how do the timeplan look, how will the requested funds be allocated.

Some information about the team has been described, but other than that, there is no information to audit the proposal. I recommend that the team read the Catalyst documentation and adapt the proposal, including metrics, roadmap, KPIs and the other items present in the documentation.

*The team submitted 2 identical proposals, so I am submitting the same rationale.
Little information is presented. The high demand in requested funding in combination with no plan to provide the community with auditability is concerning.
The progress can be audited to an extent. There is a need for the detailed roadmap and project report for enabling detailed assessment.

The proposer doesn't provides a step-by-step plan for the implementation with clear milestones and a defined time horizon, so what is the plan forward and roadmap? In my opinion it's not clear and well detailed what exactly is the problem statement and value of the solution to adopt insurance app and which is the benefits for the customers. The proposal doesn't offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation

Not wishing to repeat myself, but the proposer who submitted this proposal has not withdrawn it - but indicated that it is an error. 

He has stated in the only comment that is available to this proposal that it is an erroneous submission as his original proposal can be found here:

https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Insurance-Claims-Processing/350998-48088

So this proposal is a duplicate and if allowed to proceed with a normal assessment, it could result in voters granting funding for both versions of the same proposal - which would be an error. Hence, I am downvoting it as both cannot be auditable - because the budget would be duplicated - if both win.

However, I would also briefly touch upon the fact that the proposal itself is difficult to audit without milestones, a detailed roadmap, budget breakdown and deliverables. No consideration has been given to risks, problems and challenges.

Requesting USD150000 and not describe anything about your project, is not enough in order to have it assessed. If the team behind it are actually looking to get funding through Catalyst, I suggest re-submitting for a next round of funding.
The funds requested are very high no metrics for success are given. No roadmap or budget breakdown are given. Auditing the use of the funds does not appear possible with the given information.

The proposal is notsufficients. It does not present an exact account of the solution that is going to be implemented, no milestones and success criteria and norationale for the very high funds that are demanded.

solution: Claims data is written to the ledger and the process between the parties is automated, tokens reward honesty, honest actors are rated.
experience: We develop insurance apps (kudoinsurance.com), Mark Suleman operates a Cardano stake pool. We have decades of global systems dev experience.
